snippet: A drug crisis caused largely by an array of manufacturing problems is leading health care workers to treat patients with less-effective alternative medicines and expired drugs.
abstract: Chronic drug shortages across the United States are forcing a wide range of medical professionals to turn to rationing and the use of inferior or expired medications, among other desperate measures; caused by an array of manufacturing problems, shortages peaked in 2011, but more than 100 drugs remain in short supply.
lead_paragraph: A drug crisis caused largely by an array of manufacturing problems is leading health care workers to treat patients with less-effective alternative medicines and expired drugs.
